question.title: JDBC Connectivity issue (jar file)
question.body:
Objective

I'm trying to connect to a MySQL database using Java,

Issue

My code isn't working despite adding the MySQL Connector/J JAR file to the referenced libraries.

Code:

import java.sql.DriverManager;
import java.sql.PreparedStatement;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
        Class.forName("com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver");
        Connection con = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/jdbc_db", "root", "password");
        System.out.println("driver loading..............."); 
    }
}

Error:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver

Configuration:

  • Java Version : Java 17
  • Connector/J Version: Connector/J 8.0.28
  • MYSQL Version: MySQL 8.0.
  • Platform Windows 11.
  • IDE: VS-Code.
  • Execution: From IDE

# Stack Trace

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver
        at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.BuiltinClassLoader.loadClass(BuiltinClassLoader.java:641)
        at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoaders.java:188)
        at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:525)
        at java.base/java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
        at java.base/java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:375)
        at App.main(App.java:6)

Steps Taken:

  1. Added the MySQL Connector/J JAR file to the referenced libraries.
  2. Verified that the JAR file is in the correct location.
  3. Checked the Java code for syntax errors.

Question:

Why is my Java code not working despite adding the MySQL Connector/J JAR file to the referencedÂ libraries?
